text: Torquemada may refer to: == People == * Juan de Torquemada (cardinal) (1388–1468), Spanish cardinal and ecclesiastical writer * Tomás de Torquemada (1420–1498), prominent leader of the Spanish Inquisition * Antonio de Torquemada (c. 1507–1569), Spanish writer * Fray Juan de Torquemada (c. 1562–1624), Spanish friar, missionary and historian of the New World * Edward Powys Mathers (1892–1939) (pseudonym Torquemada), British crossword setter == Fiction == * Alonzo Torquemada, a character on the HBO drama series Oz * Horatio Torquemada Marley, Elaine Marley's grandfather in the Monkey Island series * Las novelas de Torquemada, four novels by Spanish author Benito Pérez Galdós: **Torquemada en la hoguera (1889) **Torquemada en la Cruz (1893) **Torquemada en el purgatorio (1894) **Torquemada y San Pedro (1895) * Torquemada (play), an 1869 poem and an 1882 play by Victor Hugo about the life of Tomás de Torquemada * Torquemada (comics), the main villain (Tomás de Torquemada) from the comic strip Nemesis the Warlock in the British comic 2000 AD * Torquemada, a member of the Green Lantern Corps in the DC Comics universe * Torquemada, a fortress in the 2010 video game Red Dead Redemption * Señor Torquemada, horloger de Tolède, the Clockmaker in Ravel's opera L'heure espagnole == Places == * Torquemada, Palencia, Spain == Music == * "Torquemada 71", a song by doom metal band Electric Wizard * Torquemada, a vocal piece composed by Leonardo Balada
title: Torquemada
